page.title: 03Transport
page.content: Grimethorpe,once served by the{Dearne {Valley Light Railway}from Wakefield to Edlington near Doncaster,is now well provided with public transport by the {Yorkshire Traction}Co.;the village is situated on a loop off the main A628 road,and the Y.T.C. provide 4 buses per hour to Grimethorpe,two to the White City estate and two to Red City with one continuing to Doncaster, connecting with High Speed Trains to London,reached in three hours.The frequent buses to Barnsley connect with trains to Leeds,Huddersfield & Sheffield where trains run to most destinations. There is an hourly bus from Brierley to Wakefield via Hemsworth with alternate buses running to Grimethorpe Colliery. The Sheffield -Hemsworth bus crosses Brierley Common and there are connections at Shafton for Hemsworth,Upton and Pontefract.
